subSubSection.paragraph: Squamosa chalcites Orhant, 2000. Lambillionea (100) 3: 471. Type locality Myanmar: Maymyo.

Female genitalia (Fig. 23 ). Papillae anales flattened, foot-shaped, covered with dense hairs on surface. Postvaginal plate flattened, strongly sclerotised. Apophysis anterioris highly modified, short, tongue-shaped; apophysis posterioris long and slender, c. 3 x length of apophysis anterioris. Ductus bursae long, membranous, not spiral-shaped. Corpus bursae pear-shaped, twisted in its apical part, with a strongly sclerotised, nearly elliptical central signum.

Although the female adult was described in Orhant (2000) , the female genitalia are described herein for the first time. In contrast to another known female of the genus,
S. monosa
, two distinctive features of this species can be recognised: the apophysis anterioris is highly modified, tongue-shaped; and the corpus bursae only with a single signum. However, in the female genitalia of
S. monosa
(Fig. 24 ), the apophysis anterioris is slender and the corpus bursae has a pair of signa.
